s.text: "One message coming loud and clear out of the recent flurry of diplomatic activity over a peacekeeping force for East Timor is that, as far as the United States is concerned, Australia is on its own in dealing with such regional problems," the paper said in an editorial.
"If the police force does not rush to investigate suspicions against a former prime minister, it will not have the moral justification to act against ordinary criminals," the paper said Friday.

Even so, "Mossad secretly sent agent operators to Britain to gather information on Arab targets" and "MI5 exposed these undeclared Mossad officers and quietly instructed them to leave the country."

In an op-ed article, the Guardian 's Washington correspondent asked why disasters in the United States receive so much more attention in the European press than much worse disasters elsewhere.
